title.narrative: Share-Net Colombia

description.narrative: Facilitar la generación, intercambio, discusión y apropiación del conocimiento y la evidencia científica en salud sexual, salud reproductiva y derechos sexuales y derechos reproductivos, con el fin de facilitar la toma de decisiones y uso de servicios de SSSR.

Share-Net International es una plataforma de gestión de conocimiento en salud sexual y reproductiva (SSR) y derechos sexuales y reproductivos (DSDR), se compone de redes de conocimiento nacional en diferentes países (como Share-Net Colombia) las cuales permiten la generación, traducción y divulgación de conocimiento e investigación. Share-net reúne la experticia y fortalezas de diferentes organizaciones holandesas, socios y actores internacionales clave que trabajan en SSR y DSDR para alcanzar los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible relacionados con DSDR y VIH y también estimula la participación de socios internacionales, regionales y nacionales clave en temas de DSDR.

description.narrative: The extent to which the governance of Share-Net is fit-for-purpose

comment.narrative: We held three meetings with the representative of the Netherlands Embassy in Colombia Martha Arevalo, where we presented the Share-Net Colombia project and discussed how the embassy could be involved in our activities. She also attended our launch event, where we agreed on her participation in our Steering Committee as observers.

title.narrative: Number of active Communities of Practice

description.narrative: Number of CoPs that have been established and their respective topics

comment.narrative: In our work plan we stablished 4 CoPs on: Gender-Based Violence, Abortion, SRHR connections with the SDG, and Sexuality, Health, Rights and Ageing. However, only the first three were expected to be stablished in 2021, for the last one it was only planned to create a State-of-the-art document. This means that our original target was 3 CoPs, but we informed SNI about only being able to stablish two: -Community of Practice on Gender-Based Violence. For this CoP we carried out 5 meetings from October to December: introduction, logistical and technical aspects, knowledge products (1), knowledge products (2), and knowledge product ideas review/2021 closing. -Community of Practice on Abortion. For this CoP we carried out several meetings with potential members where we explained about the CoP purpose and work methodology. This was the introduction session and invitation to work in the CoP. After that we schedule a second meeting grouping the interested organizations to determine some technical and logistical aspects (like the meeting frequency and tools), and to stablish a framework of different topics that the organizations and participants were interested to work in for 2022.
